radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is mildly diffusely echogenic. The contour of the liver is smooth. There is no focal liver mass. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites. There is no intrahepatic biliary dilation. The CHD measures 8 mm. Several stones are noted within the gall bladder without gallbladder-wall thickening or gallbladder-wall edema. There is no pericholecystic fluid. The pancreas is not well visualized, largely obscured by overlying bowel gas. The spleen has normal echogenicity, upper limits of normal in size measuring 12 cm. Limited views of the right kidney show no hydronephrosis. The visualized portions of aorta and IVC are within normal limits.
